abstracts.cdata!:
On September 4, 2009 the Inspection
            Panel received a request for inspection from the Center for
            Rousing Rights and Evictions (CORRE), which submitted the
            request on behalf of communities affected by the Cambodia
            Land Management and Administration Project. These
            communities are situated in the Boeung Kak Lake (BKL) area,
            within the Sras Chok commune, Daun Penh district in Phnom
            Penh. The Requesters asked the panel to keep the names of
            affected people and villages where they live confidential.
            The panel registered the request on September 24, 2009 and
            management submitted its response (the 'management
            response') on November 2, 2009. In view of the
            foregoing, the panel recommends that the Board of Executive
            Directors approves an investigation of the claims and
            matters raised by the request for inspection. The panel
            notes that the investigation would take into account
            progress in the implementation of the actions noted in the
            management response and other actions being carried out to
            address the concerns raised by the Requesters.
